intro: Homalobus lancearius, commonly known as the lanceleaf homalobus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained soil and full sun.
